designations.source: A review of the Hemiptera of Great Britain: The shieldbugs and allied families
designations.source_description: This report was commissioned to update the national status of shield bugs using IUCN methodology for assessing threat. It covers all species of Coreoidea, Pentatomoidea & Pyrrhocoroidea in Great Britain, identifying those that are rare and/or under threat as well as non threatened and non-native species.
designations.reporting_category: Nationally Scarce, Nationally Rare and Other Species
designations.designation: Nationally Rare. Includes Red Listed taxa
designations.designation_description: Nationally Rare - Occurring in 15 or fewer hectads in Great Britain. Includes rare species qualifying under the main IUCN criteria.
designations.comments: Historic literature suggests this species probably was established in south-west Britain during the late 19th century, although only a single undated specimen from Devon is present in BMNH. The taxonomic status of C. mediterraneus and C. fuscispinus has been an area of much recent dabate.

designations.reporting_category: Red listing based on 2001 IUCN guidelines
designations.designation_description: Category for a taxon when there is no reasonable doubt that the last individual potentially capble of reproduction within the region has died or has disappeared from the wild in the region, or when, if it is a former visiting taxon, the last individual has died or disappeared in the wild from the region. The setting of any time limit for listing under RE is left to the discretion of the regional Red List authority, but should not normally pre-date 1500 AD.
